title: free didone numbers
content:
Hello,

A few years ago, there was some beautiful didone numbers, that you could get for free.  
Now I have a situation where I need them and I just can't remember the name of the designer or anything that could point me to them.

The image linked here is close to what I have in my memories, maybe someone here sees what I'm talking about ?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820054238im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ErikMarinovich_CinMag_02_6671.gif)
author: laurent

comments.content:
These numerals were [created by Erik Marinovich for the opening feature of Cincinnati Magazine annual ‘Where to Eat’ issue](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820054238/http:/www.erikmarinovich.com/work/cincinnati-magazine).  
I can remember the [Pompadour Numerals](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820054238/http:/www.losttype.com/font/?name=pompadour) by Andy Mangold (which have been turned into font since) and the [Christmas Numerals](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820054238/http:/www.behance.net/gallery/Christmas-Numerals-(Free-Font)/6278933) by Stereotypes Sasha Timplan.

BTW Laurent, I just released a new set of numbers.  
Not free, but almost. Only $15.  
 [https://creativemarket.com/Impallari/2957-Clement-Numbers](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820054238/https:/creativemarket.com/Impallari/2957-Clement-Numbers "https://creativemarket.com/Impallari/2957-Clement-Numbers")

No cigar, I think now, looking back, the designer was a girl.  
Any way, for now I'll go with the Christmas numerals.  
Thank you Ryuk, you've been helpful.
